content.description:
Good option to get to the upper ledge to climb Smoking Lair or Shamalamamoomoo. Climb the corner crack taking gear up to 3" including one bolt up high to keep the rope out of the dirt, especially helpful for the second who will get loose dirt in their eyes.



Scrappy corner directly right of Hummingbird.

Trad gear and one bolt. Rappel ring anchors

This is the direct start to the second pitch of Shamalamamoomoo. Climb direct up from the belay for 4 bolts and then merge with that route, sticking to the bolts on the plumb line. Expect big reaches on small holds but with good feet. Rock is solid through the cruxes. 



Start at the belay ledge for the second pitch of Shamalamamoomoo

8 bolts. Rappel ring anchors.

First pitch 10b, 7 bolts. Ok rock gets you up to a nice ledge where the second pitch starts. Great views of the lake from here!

Second pitch 11c, 11 bolts. Route traverses out right (crux) to a line of weakness that brings the route back left to directly above the belay. Tops out the wall on good holds. 

To rappel use the rappel station between pitches one and two to rappel most of the vegetated ledge back to near the top anchor for 'Chip'



From the top of Chip scramble up to a short dirty crack and up to another vegetated ledge with a small cedar tree where the climb starts.

Bolts. Rappel ring anchors
A tall face with an ominous crescent roof overlooking the lake.
